alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Leon (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 6:51AM EDT until April 11 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Ochlockonee River near Concord (CR 12) affecting Leon and Gadsden Counties. For the Ochlockonee River...including Concord (CR 12)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ochlockonee River near Concord (CR 12). * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, Primary access to homes along county highway 12 on the east bank of the river in Leon County may become restricted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 36.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EDT Friday was 36.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 35.4 feet and then begin rising early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise again to 36.0 feet Sunday evening. It will fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 36.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 36.2 feet on 01/08/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later today.
